Params: {1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory748.jpg'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Rosetta', 3: 'So what do I do... Just flip this card over?', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Fortune Teller', 3: "Bingo! It's just like a card game—draw a fortune-telling card from the deck to see what's in store for you!"}
{3: 'A few minutes ago, Rosetta noticed the flashy card designs at the fortune-telling booth and pulled you inside with her.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Rosetta', 3: "Hmm... I'll go with these.", 4: '1'}
{3: "At first, she mistakes the fortune-telling cards for a simple card game, but after realizing they're actually for divination, she grows visibly uneasy."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Fortune Teller', 3: 'These cards, huh...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Fortune Teller', 3: "This one suggests you've gone through a long stretch of hardship, and now you're about to set off on a journey overflowing with good fortune.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Fortune Teller', 3: "This card indicates that your lover is dedicated to a major cause. Even though you two are apart for a while, you're going to meet again very soon.", 4: '1'}
{3: "Her voice only goes up for a split second, but for Rosetta—who's usually so composed—that brief reaction is already a rare sign of emotion."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Fortune Teller', 3: 'Forgive me... in that case, your "friend" is dedicated to a major cause...', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Rosetta', 3: "I... didn't mean it like that...", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Fortune Teller', 3: 'Ohhhh! Then you and your loverrr...', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 3: "The Construct beside you parts her lips slightly, but never interrupts the fortune-teller's drawn-out speech."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Fortune Teller', 3: "It's just like the cowherd and the weaver girl. Even if you're separated for ages, your bond never fades...", 4: '1'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory1000.jpg'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Rosetta', 3: 'Commandant.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'You step out of the fortune-telling booth with Rosetta, and she suddenly takes hold of your hand.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Rosetta', 3: "I guess I'm still not used to this kind of game.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'You turn to look at Rosetta. Her expression is conflicted—like something is weighing on her mind.'}
{2: 'Why?', 3: '39', 4: 'I remember you really like card games, right?', 5: '38'}
{3: "You know Rosetta's preferences by heart, and you're well aware that fortune-telling cards aren't exactly standard card-game material. Still, you just can't help messing with her a bit."}
{2: 'Rosetta', 3: "Hmm... a fortune-telling deck really does rely on luck, doesn't it?", 4: '1'}
{2: "But this reading doesn't look bad at all.", 3: '42', 4: "Right now, we really are by each other's side, just like the fortune teller said.", 5: '42'}
{2: 'Rosetta', 3: "It's true—I don't mind drawing a winning hand in a game, just like I enjoy a stroke of good luck.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Rosetta', 3: "But... if a game's outcome depends solely on fate, it unsettles me.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Rosetta', 3: "【kuroname】... I keep thinking: if you weren't here with me today, would the fortune teller's cards still turn out this lucky?", 4: '1'}
{3: 'She tilts her head back slightly, looking a bit lost, and you follow her gaze upward.'}
{3: "In Constellia's night sky, countless stars sprawl across a dazzling canvas. The radiant Milky Way cuts through the darkness, linking distant constellations on both sides."}

{2: 'Rosetta', 3: "I've heard that Kowloong story, the one the fortune-teller mentioned about the cowherd and the weaver girl. They remain apart for ages, only able to meet once a year on Double Seventh when they cross the Magpie Bridge.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Rosetta', 3: "It's such a romantic story... but I can't help feeling it's unfair to those two. They have to endure endless separation, all for a brief, precious reunion.", 4: '1'}

{2: 'Rosetta', 3: "I refuse to accept the destiny the universe has set for them; I can't stand the thought that, in this story, the cowherd and the weaver girl have no choice but to obey fate.", 4: '1'}

{2: 'Rosetta', 3: "【kuroname】, my homeland is frozen all year round, and the warm season vanishes in a heartbeat—just like the Double Seventh Festival. Most people see it as a ruthless place where survival doesn't come easy.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Rosetta', 3: 'But the people of the Arctic Route Union hold their tools tight, settling in and making their stand against that endless expanse of snow and ice.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Rosetta', 3: 'When I was young, my grandfather and I stood at the port, watching the sea stretch out before us.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Rosetta', 3: 'A high-speed icebreaker cut through the thick sheets of ice, opening up a safe route for the port. The sound of shattering ice still echoes in my ears, even now.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'She lowers her gaze from the star-filled sky and turns toward you with a serious look.'}
{2: 'Rosetta', 3: "I'm not used to fortune-telling. It's nothing like a normal card game where players can change the outcome.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Rosetta', 3: "In the Arctic, the ice never melts. But the Union's icebreakers cut through any obstacle, and I do the same, 【kuroname】.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Rosetta', 3: "You're my lucky charm. But even without you around, no matter how bad my luck gets, I still push through everything...", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Rosetta', 3: "If this is our match, I'm not letting anyone else take over the game.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Rosetta', 3: "Whether it's non-melting ice or an endless galaxy, I don't wait for a warm season or some special day.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Rosetta', 3: "I'm coming to you... taking you back from those countless days and nights.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'The grip in your palm tightens, and her eyes never waver.'}
{2: "Rosetta, you're taking this too seriously.", 3: '75', 4: "I'm coming to see you, too.", 5: '79', 6: 'I trust you.', 7: '81'}
{2: 'Rosetta', 3: 'Really? Even so, I really want you to feel this from the bottom of my heart.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Rosetta', 3: 'Today is special, so let me be a little more earnest than usual.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Rosetta', 3: 'Of course, your decisions always make me believe we are meant to meet.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Rosetta', 3: 'Of course, your faith in me never fails to give me all the encouragement I need.', 4: '1'}
{2: "(Grip Rosetta's hand)", 3: '84', 4: '(Press your forehead gently against hers)', 5: '87'}
{3: "Rosetta's hand feels warm and steady as she holds you tight. Then..."}
{3: 'She closes her eyes and gently leans her forehead toward you.'}
{3: "It's unusual to see her looking this bashful."}
{2: 'You usually show your thanks like this...', 3: '91', 4: 'You seem not used to being treated the same way you treat others.', 5: '91'}
{2: 'Rosetta', 3: "I haven't done anything worth you thanking me for, have I? So... um...", 4: '1'}
{3: 'She shifts her gaze for a moment, then gently closes her eyes and presses her forehead against yours.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Rosetta', 3: 'Thank you, 【kuroname】. May my good luck always stay with me.', 4: '1'}
